trans-unit.source: Create a SQL Server LOB target to insert purchase order
trans-unit.target: Create a SQL Server LOB target to insert purchase order

trans-unit.source: This topic provides instructions on how to create an SQL Server <token>lobtarget</token> within the <token>msgflow_proj</token>.
trans-unit.target: This topic provides instructions on how to create an SQL Server <token>lobtarget</token> within the <token>msgflow_proj</token>.

trans-unit.source: You use this <token>lobtarget</token> to insert customer order data into the <embeddedLabel>Orders</embeddedLabel> table in the <embeddedLabel>CloudCarDatabase</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: You use this <token>lobtarget</token> to insert customer order data into the <embeddedLabel>Orders</embeddedLabel> table in the <embeddedLabel>CloudCarDatabase</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: You must have already created the database and the table by using the <embeddedLabel>CreateDatabaseSchema_CloudCar.sql</embeddedLabel> script provided with the sample available in the MSDN code gallery at <externalLink><linkText>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=324220</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=324220</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: You must have already created the database and the table by using the <embeddedLabel>CreateDatabaseSchema_CloudCar.sql</embeddedLabel> script provided with the sample available in the MSDN code gallery at <externalLink><linkText>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=324220</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=324220</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: To create an SQL Server LOB target
trans-unit.target: To create an SQL Server LOB target

trans-unit.source: Add a <token>lobconnect</token> server.
trans-unit.target: Add a <token>lobconnect</token> server.

trans-unit.source: This is the server where you installed the Runtime component of <token>lobconnect</token>.
trans-unit.target: This is the server where you installed the Runtime component of <token>lobconnect</token>.

trans-unit.source: To add a <token>lobconnect</token> server, from the Server Explorer in Visual Studio, right-click <embeddedLabel><token>lobconnect</token></embeddedLabel>s, and select <embeddedLabel>Add <token>lobconnect</token></embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: To add a <token>lobconnect</token> server, from the Server Explorer in Visual Studio, right-click <embeddedLabel><token>lobconnect</token></embeddedLabel>s, and select <embeddedLabel>Add <token>lobconnect</token></embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Add <token>lobconnect</token></embeddedLabel> dialog box, enter the URL of the WCF service that monitors that <token>sb2</token> relay service, and then select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>Add <token>lobconnect</token></embeddedLabel> dialog box, enter the URL of the WCF service that monitors that <token>sb2</token> relay service, and then select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Because you have all the components of <token>lobconnect</token> installed on the same computer, the URL for that service will be <codeInline>http://localhost:8080/BAService/ManagementService.svc/</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: Because you have all the components of <token>lobconnect</token> installed on the same computer, the URL for that service will be <codeInline>http://localhost:8080/BAService/ManagementService.svc/</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: If you installed <token>lobconnect</token> Runtime component on a separate computer, you must replace ‘localhost’ in the above URL with the name of that computer.
trans-unit.target: If you installed <token>lobconnect</token> Runtime component on a separate computer, you must replace ‘localhost’ in the above URL with the name of that computer.

trans-unit.source: Expand the newly added <token>lobconnect</token> management service URL, expand <embeddedLabel>LOB Types</embeddedLabel>, right-click <embeddedLabel>SQL</embeddedLabel>, and select <embeddedLabel>Add SQL Target</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Expand the newly added <token>lobconnect</token> management service URL, expand <embeddedLabel>LOB Types</embeddedLabel>, right-click <embeddedLabel>SQL</embeddedLabel>, and select <embeddedLabel>Add SQL Target</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The <embeddedLabel>Add a Target</embeddedLabel> wizard starts.
trans-unit.target: The <embeddedLabel>Add a Target</embeddedLabel> wizard starts.

trans-unit.source: Read the information on the <embeddedLabel>Before You Begin</embeddedLabel> page, and then select <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Read the information on the <embeddedLabel>Before You Begin</embeddedLabel> page, and then select <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: On the <embeddedLabel>Connection Parameters</embeddedLabel> page, enter the details for the SQL Server to connect to and the credentials to use for the connection.
trans-unit.target: On the <embeddedLabel>Connection Parameters</embeddedLabel> page, enter the details for the SQL Server to connect to and the credentials to use for the connection.

trans-unit.source: For the <embeddedLabel>Server</embeddedLabel> field, enter the name of the computer where SQL Server is installed and for the database (<embeddedLabel>Initial Catalog</embeddedLabel>), enter <userInput>CloudCarDatabase</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: For the <embeddedLabel>Server</embeddedLabel> field, enter the name of the computer where SQL Server is installed and for the database (<embeddedLabel>Initial Catalog</embeddedLabel>), enter <userInput>CloudCarDatabase</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: You can use the <embeddedLabel>Advanced</embeddedLabel> button to build the SQL Server connection URI and also enter the binding properties for the connection.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <embeddedLabel>Advanced</embeddedLabel> button to build the SQL Server connection URI and also enter the binding properties for the connection.

trans-unit.source: <externalLink><linkText>The SQL Server Connection URI</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=228970</linkUri></externalLink> provides additional information about how to build the URI.
trans-unit.target: <externalLink><linkText>The SQL Server Connection URI</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=228970</linkUri></externalLink> provides additional information about how to build the URI.

trans-unit.source: For information about binding properties, see <externalLink><linkText>Working with BizTalk Adapter for SQL Server Binding Properties</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=228971</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For information about binding properties, see <externalLink><linkText>Working with BizTalk Adapter for SQL Server Binding Properties</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=228971</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, leave the default setting as-is for the binding properties.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, leave the default setting as-is for the binding properties.

trans-unit.source: Enter the credentials to connect to the SQL Server database.
trans-unit.target: Enter the credentials to connect to the SQL Server database.

trans-unit.source: You must have already added that user as a system administrator in the SQL Server database.
trans-unit.target: You must have already added that user as a system administrator in the SQL Server database.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: On the <embeddedLabel>Operations</embeddedLabel> page, from the left box, expand <embeddedLabel>Tables</embeddedLabel>, expand <embeddedLabel>Orders</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>Insert</embeddedLabel>, and then select the RIGHT ARROW.
trans-unit.target: On the <embeddedLabel>Operations</embeddedLabel> page, from the left box, expand <embeddedLabel>Tables</embeddedLabel>, expand <embeddedLabel>Orders</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>Insert</embeddedLabel>, and then select the RIGHT ARROW.

trans-unit.source: Notice that the <embeddedLabel>Insert</embeddedLabel> operation is listed under the <embeddedLabel>Selected operations</embeddedLabel> section.
trans-unit.target: Notice that the <embeddedLabel>Insert</embeddedLabel> operation is listed under the <embeddedLabel>Selected operations</embeddedLabel> section.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Select Next</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Select Next</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Runtime Security</embeddedLabel> page, enter the security type.
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>Runtime Security</embeddedLabel> page, enter the security type.

trans-unit.source: This security type determines how the client message is authenticated with the <token>lobtarget</token>.
trans-unit.target: This security type determines how the client message is authenticated with the <token>lobtarget</token>.

trans-unit.source: Options include:
trans-unit.target: Options include:

trans-unit.source: Fixed Username
trans-unit.target: Fixed Username

trans-unit.source: Select this option if you are using a username and password created locally on the LOB system.
trans-unit.target: Select this option if you are using a username and password created locally on the LOB system.

trans-unit.source: Fixed Windows credential
trans-unit.target: Fixed Windows credential

trans-unit.source: Select this option to use a Windows domain account.
trans-unit.target: Select this option to use a Windows domain account.

trans-unit.source: Custom SOAP Header
trans-unit.target: Custom SOAP Header

trans-unit.source: Select this option if you create a custom SOAP header to include the username and password.
trans-unit.target: Select this option if you create a custom SOAP header to include the username and password.

trans-unit.source: Message Credential
trans-unit.target: Message Credential

trans-unit.source: Select this option if you are including the logon credentials in the WS-Security header of the message.
trans-unit.target: Select this option if you are including the logon credentials in the WS-Security header of the message.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial use the <embeddedLabel>Fixed Username</embeddedLabel> option, enter the same credentials that you use to connect to the computer running SQL Server, and then select <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial use the <embeddedLabel>Fixed Username</embeddedLabel> option, enter the same credentials that you use to connect to the computer running SQL Server, and then select <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: On the <embeddedLabel>Deployment</embeddedLabel> page, choose an existing <token>lobrelay</token> or create a new <token>lobrelay</token>.
trans-unit.target: On the <embeddedLabel>Deployment</embeddedLabel> page, choose an existing <token>lobrelay</token> or create a new <token>lobrelay</token>.

trans-unit.source: To create a new <token>lobrelay</token>, enter the following details:
trans-unit.target: To create a new <token>lobrelay</token>, enter the following details:

trans-unit.source: Namespace
trans-unit.target: Namespace

trans-unit.source: Enter the <token>sb2</token> namespace on which the LOB relay endpoint is created.
trans-unit.target: Enter the <token>sb2</token> namespace on which the LOB relay endpoint is created.

trans-unit.source: Issuer Name
trans-unit.target: Issuer Name

trans-unit.source: Enter the issuer name for the <token>sb2</token> namespace.
trans-unit.target: Enter the issuer name for the <token>sb2</token> namespace.

trans-unit.source: Issuer Secret
trans-unit.target: Issuer Secret

trans-unit.source: Enter the issuer secret for the <token>sb2</token> namespace.
trans-unit.target: Enter the issuer secret for the <token>sb2</token> namespace.

trans-unit.source: Relay Path
trans-unit.target: Relay Path

trans-unit.source: Enter a name for the relay.
trans-unit.target: Enter a name for the relay.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, enter <userInput>SQLtarget</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, enter <userInput>SQLtarget</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: Target Sub-path
trans-unit.target: Target Sub-path

trans-unit.source: Enter a sub-path to make this target unique.
trans-unit.target: Enter a sub-path to make this target unique.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, enter <userInput>orders</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, enter <userInput>orders</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: Target runtime URL
trans-unit.target: Target runtime URL

trans-unit.source: This read-only property displays the URL where the relay is deployed on <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: This read-only property displays the URL where the relay is deployed on <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: This is the endpoint where you can send a message with a compliant schema to be inserted into the on-premises SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: This is the endpoint where you can send a message with a compliant schema to be inserted into the on-premises SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: On the <embeddedLabel>Summary</embeddedLabel> page, review the values you specified in the previous steps, and then select <embeddedLabel>Create</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: On the <embeddedLabel>Summary</embeddedLabel> page, review the values you specified in the previous steps, and then select <embeddedLabel>Create</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: When the wizard completes, select <embeddedLabel>Finish</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: When the wizard completes, select <embeddedLabel>Finish</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The following activities occur in the background:
trans-unit.target: The following activities occur in the background:

trans-unit.source: An <token>lobtarget</token> is created in Server Explorer.
trans-unit.target: An <token>lobtarget</token> is created in Server Explorer.

trans-unit.source: It can be disabled, started, and deleted.
trans-unit.target: It can be disabled, started, and deleted.

trans-unit.source: Its configuration can also be exported.
trans-unit.target: Its configuration can also be exported.

trans-unit.source: An <token>lobtarget</token> is created as an application in IIS.
trans-unit.target: An <token>lobtarget</token> is created as an application in IIS.

trans-unit.source: This application uses the Runtime for this specific <token>lobtarget</token>.
trans-unit.target: This application uses the Runtime for this specific <token>lobtarget</token>.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="355e839a-c2ca-48e2-bc2e-e3cd1ad32466" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Runtime: ServiceBus Connect Service Runtime Components</link> describes the IIS components.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="355e839a-c2ca-48e2-bc2e-e3cd1ad32466" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Runtime: ServiceBus Connect Service Runtime Components</link> describes the IIS components.

trans-unit.source: In the <token>msgflow_proj</token>, include the schemas for the <embeddedLabel>Insert</embeddedLabel> operation on the <embeddedLabel>Orders</embeddedLabel> table.
trans-unit.target: In the <token>msgflow_proj</token>, include the schemas for the <embeddedLabel>Insert</embeddedLabel> operation on the <embeddedLabel>Orders</embeddedLabel> table.

trans-unit.source: Make sure the <embeddedLabel>CloudCar_Integration_PurchaseOrder</embeddedLabel> project is selected in the Solution Explorer when you perform the following steps.
trans-unit.target: Make sure the <embeddedLabel>CloudCar_Integration_PurchaseOrder</embeddedLabel> project is selected in the Solution Explorer when you perform the following steps.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the SQL <token>lobtarget</token> you created for the <embeddedLabel>Orders</embeddedLabel> table, and select the option to add schemas to the project.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the SQL <token>lobtarget</token> you created for the <embeddedLabel>Orders</embeddedLabel> table, and select the option to add schemas to the project.

trans-unit.source: For <embeddedLabel>File name prefix</embeddedLabel>, enter <userInput>PO_</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: For <embeddedLabel>File name prefix</embeddedLabel>, enter <userInput>PO_</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: Retain the folder name as <embeddedLabel>LOB Schemas</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Retain the folder name as <embeddedLabel>LOB Schemas</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: For <embeddedLabel>Credential Type</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>Windows</embeddedLabel>, and then select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: For <embeddedLabel>Credential Type</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>Windows</embeddedLabel>, and then select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Finally, set the security property for the relay endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Finally, set the security property for the relay endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the <token>lobtarget</token> in Server Explorer and select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the <token>lobtarget</token> in Server Explorer and select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In the Properties grid, select the ellipsis <embeddedLabel>(…)</embeddedLabel> against the <embeddedLabel>Runtime Security</embeddedLabel> property.
trans-unit.target: In the Properties grid, select the ellipsis <embeddedLabel>(…)</embeddedLabel> against the <embeddedLabel>Runtime Security</embeddedLabel> property.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Edit Security</embeddedLabel> dialog box, select <embeddedLabel>Fixed Windows Credentials</embeddedLabel> and enter username and password to connect to the <token>ssNoVersion</token>.
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>Edit Security</embeddedLabel> dialog box, select <embeddedLabel>Fixed Windows Credentials</embeddedLabel> and enter username and password to connect to the <token>ssNoVersion</token>.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Save changes to the project.
trans-unit.target: Save changes to the project.
